page.title: 13A FARM IN MARSTON TRUSSELL
page.content: All 600 acres of{Strattford Farm}is owned by a college in Oxford. Mrs. Mackintosh, who has worked there for 6 years tells us that the farm is to be sold for two million pounds. The farm workers live in tied houses and because of this they are worried about their future. The farmer starts work at 5.00am and works until dusk. Half the farm is used for growing{cereals}and the remainder is for grazing{beef}and {dairy}cattle.Haymaking and calving are the busiest times of the year. The{farmhouse}was built in 1743 and has lots of tunnels coming through from the church.In one of the bedrooms there is a priest hole 6 feet under the floorboards. Mr.Mackintosh is in the egg trade,he buys deep litter eggs and sells them on.
